Three charged particles, each of mass <math alttext="M" overflow="scroll"><mi>M</mi></math>, are arranged in an <math alttext="x y" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-coordinate plane at the positions shown in Figure <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. Particle <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> has a net negative charge <math alttext="negative Q" overflow="scroll"><mo>−</mo><mi>Q</mi></math> and particles <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> and <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> each have a net positive charge <math alttext="positive Q" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mi>Q</mi></math>. Particles <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> and <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> are fixed in place and Particle <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> is held in place by a force <math alttext="F sub H" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>H</mtext></msub></math>. Particles <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> and <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> remain fixed in place while Particle <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"> <mn>1</mn> </math> is then released from rest and sometime later is instantaneously located at the origin <math alttext="the point with coordinates 0 comma 0" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>0</mn></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>. Neglect gravitational forces.
